stream_context.summary: Kaze used the stream to brainstorm and prototype visual ideas for Course 13 (Ice Castle) while locking in broad themes for Courses 14 and 15. He live-tweaked N64 combiner settings, fog and textures to achieve a surreal, high-contrast ice aesthetic, all while fielding chat ideas about level order, difficulty curve, bosses and themes.

development_findings.summary: Several current builds crash on Project 64 and other emulators because of accuracy issues and an unidentified memory-corruption bug.
development_findings.quote: "Right now the game has a lot of issues on a lot of emulators. There isn't much I can do about it."

development_findings.summary: Course 13 will be a gloomy, surreal Ice Castle focused on platforming, minimal puzzles and possibly hexagonal room layouts with high-contrast lighting and crystal spikes.
development_findings.quote: "I think the ice castle is supposed to be difficult and kind of platformy … kind of a surreal castle."

development_findings.summary: Boss concept for Course 13 leans toward Raphael the Raven re-imagined: Mario reaches a tower, the moon looms, the Raven leaps in for a cinematic fight. A giant rolling snow-man was discussed as fallback.
development_findings.quote: "If you get to the highest tower and you look around and the moon is big in the background… then like a cut-scene starts and he just jumps in front of you."

development_findings.summary: Course 14 (formerly 15) is now a craft-materials world (cardboard, paper, glue, googly-eyes, rulers, crayons, etc.), moved after Biobak’s suggestion; it will be mostly platforming with simple NPCs made of paper.
Space Casino remains a dark, neon, platform-centric Course (now 15) featuring minigames; a caterpillar enemy is confirmed.
A proposed day-night cycle level was dropped because required waiting periods were deemed "anti-fun."
development_findings.quote: "There would be places where you'd have to wait for 30 seconds, which is just lame."

development_findings.summary: Coins will be used in the overworld as currency for upgrades; every main course promises a retro pipe side-area—Kaze is reluctant to break that convention.

Kaze experimented with three-layer N64 combiner setups: environment-mapped semi-transparent ice, dark inner spikes, and snow decals; he wants a trailing “frame-buffer not cleared” effect for surreal ambience.
Design philosophy reiterated: avoid puzzles, keep late-game courses heavily platform-based; boss fights valued more as visual set pieces than gameplay tests.
development_findings.quote: "Boss fights in video games are like zero fun for me. I can only appreciate them as a set piece."

development_findings.summary: Technical stance: prefers C/assembly over higher-level languages, encourages using ChatGPT for engine questions, and stresses math literacy for gameplay programming.

context_findings.summary: Kaze dislikes Xbox controllers, prefers GameCube pads, and works on real N64 hardware when possible.
He streams from his basement office; Zeina now has her own workspace, so is rarely on camera.
He views ChatGPT as a practical learning tool and jokes it ‘takes jobs’ from bad tutorial channels.
He sees legal or Nintendo concerns as irrelevant to design choices; the team bases nothing on what other hackers (e.g., Brodude) have already done.
context_findings.quote: "Great. Now we can do it, because Brodude didn't do it."

biobak.summary: Suggested the craft-materials theme and agreed that Space Casino’s caterpillar enemy should be dark with glowing lights.
Advised on engagement style (platform-focused vs. minigame) during theme discussions.

zeina.summary: Accidentally shaved a strip of Kaze’s hair when the guard slipped, leaving him temporarily half-bald.
zeina.quote: "She took the top thing off to clean the razor and she just kept going—huge bald line."

zeina.summary: Works in a separate office now; absent during most streams.

key_stories.title: Emulator instability
key_stories.summary: Project 64 and other emulators crash certain levels because the hack exploits edge-case hardware behavior. Kaze is monitoring but has no immediate fix.
key_stories.challenge: Players report crashes, especially in Project 64.
key_stories.process: Kaze tested multiple versions, confirmed memory corruption, and advises 1.6 as ‘least bad’.
key_stories.outcome: Issue remains open; real hardware runs fine but wider compatibility is a goal.
key_stories.key_quote: "Hopefully it just fixes itself magically like usual."

key_stories.title: Day-night mechanic rejected
key_stories.summary: A two-state ‘time-shift’ level was brainstormed but killed when Kaze realized mandatory wait periods would frustrate players.
key_stories.challenge: Find a fresh mechanic for the final course.
key_stories.process: Considered 30-second day-night swaps; chat noted THI precedent; Kaze weighed fun vs. inconvenience.
key_stories.outcome: Mechanic scrapped; focus shifted to craft-materials theme instead.

key_stories.title: Zeina’s haircut mishap
key_stories.summary: While trimming Kaze’s hair, Zeina removed the guard and shaved a visible bald stripe.
key_stories.process: She continued cutting, leaving an obvious line; Kaze recounts humorously on stream.
key_stories.outcome: Temporary appearance change; highlights personal dynamic.
key_stories.key_quote: "I just had a fucking bald line right here for half my head."

open_questions.context: Kaze is still dissatisfied with contrast, fog and spike rendering; multiple shader passes are expensive.
questions: What final art pipeline will deliver the depth and contrast he wants?
How will back-face performance be handled on real hardware?

open_questions.context: They discussed re-ordering levels so players learn controls progressively.
questions: Has the new course order been finalized?
Any planned playtesting process to validate curve?

open_questions.context: Several concepts (Raphael on the moon, giant snowman) remain undecided.
questions: How will the fight be staged within N64 limits?
Who will animate and compose its elements?

open_questions.context: Frequent on-stream hangs without clear root cause.
questions: What specific code paths are failing?
